citation.article-title: Rhodanobacter ginsengisoli sp. nov. and Rhodanobacter terrae sp. nov., isolated from soil cultivated with Korean ginseng.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodanobacter terrae sp. nov.
Rhodanobacter terrae (ter′rae. L. gen. n. terrae of the earth).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, aerobic rods (0.5×2.0–5.0 μm).
Temperature range for growth is 5–30 °C; no growth occurs at 35 °C.
Tolerates up to 2 % NaCl, but not 3 % NaCl.
Colonies on R2A medium are yellow, circular and slightly convex with clear margins.
Positive for catalase, oxidase and β-galactosidase.
Negative for nitrate reduction, glucose fermentation, indole production, arginine dihydrolase and urease.
Hydrolyses aesculin, Tween 80 and tyrosine, but not casein, chitin, carboxymethylcellulose, DNA, gelatin, pectin or starch.
Major fatty acids are iso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C16 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 62.5 mol%.
The type strain, GP18-1T (=KACC 11761T=DSM 19241T), was isolated from a soil sample from a ginseng field in Ansung province, South Korea.
